Class Floyd

  • java.lang.Object
    • Floyd

  • public class Floyd
extends Object
    Uses Floyd's Algorithm to find the shortest path of all nodes in a directed graph. A correctly formatted file can be passed in as command line arguments, otherwise the user will be prompted to enter the number of nodes and the direct cost of each edge in the directed graph.
    Version:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Kyle Hewitt

      Reads directed graph information from a file.
      private Floyd(Scanner scn)
      Takes directed graph information from the user in the console.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      private void FloydsAlgorithm(int D, int[][] linkTable)
      Recursively calculates the shortest path from any node to any other node using Floyd's Algorithm.
      static void main(String[] args) 
      private void printTable(int D, int[][] linkTable)

    • Field Detail

      • dynamicTable

        private int[][] dynamicTable

    • Constructor Detail

      • Floyd

        private Floyd(File f)
       throws IOException
        Reads directed graph information from a file. The file is expecting a format specifying how many edges are in the graph. Each weight from a node to itself must be zero and -1 represents no connection.
        Parameters:
        f - The file passed in containing the directed graph specification
        Throws:
        IOException

      • Floyd

        private Floyd(Scanner scn)
        Takes directed graph information from the user in the console. Automatically fills in zero in node weights to themselves. -1 represents no connection
        Parameters:
        scn - Scanner used for user input

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)

      • FloydsAlgorithm

        private void FloydsAlgorithm(int D,
                             int[][] linkTable)
        Recursively calculates the shortest path from any node to any other node using Floyd's Algorithm. Each recursive step is printed out to the console in a table.
        Parameters:
        D - The recursive iteration representing the intermediate node
        linkTable - Table that represents the intermediate node to the lowest cost path

      • printTable

        private void printTable(int D,
                        int[][] linkTable)
        Prints out the table of the calculated shortest path in each recursive iteration.
        Parameters:
        D - The recursive iteration representing the intermediate node
        linkTable - Table that represents the intermediate node to the lowest cost path
